Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of vaccines by stating that they will remove parts of DNA and replace it with genetic coding, causing people to have to cooperate with the New World Order.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence that vaccines would remove any part of genomic DNA and replace it with any other DNA.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that vaccines will alter DNA and force cooperation with the New World Order.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a link between vaccines and the New World Order without providing any logical or factual basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or possibilities for the purpose and effects of vaccines, such as their role in preventing diseases and promoting public health.
